title: Rear Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Remove the two fixings and remove the heel guard.
Drain the fluid from the master cylinder by bleeding the system at the rear caliper until all fluid has been expelled.
Remove the clip from the clevis pin at the lower end of the brake push rod.
Note the orientation of the rear brake hose to the master cylinder for installation.
Disconnect the rear brake hose from the master cylinder, noting its orientation. Discard the two sealing washers.
Remove the screws that attach the master cylinder to the control plate and detach the master cylinder.
Disconnect the reservoir hose and remove the master cylinder.
